title: Fixed-parameter tractability of multicut parameterized by the size of the cutset.
abstract: Given an undirected graph $G$, a collection {(s 1 ,t 1 ), ..., (s l ,t l )} of pairs of vertices, and an integer p, the Edge Multicut problem ask if there is a set  S  of at most p edges such that the removal of S disconnects every s i  from the corresponding t i . Vertex Multicut is the analogous problem where S is a set of at most p vertices. Our main result is that both problems can be solved in time 2 O(p 3 )  ⋅ n O(1) , i.e., fixed-parameter tractable parameterized by the size p of the cutset in the solution. By contrast, it is unlikely that an algorithm with running time of the form f(p) ⋅ n O(1)  exists for the directed version of the problem, as we show it to be W[1]-hard parameterized by the size of the cutset.
